intro: Eriogonum trichopes subsp. glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular leaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its glandular-pubescent leaves and small, clustered white to pinkish flowers. The species belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
